name: Avoid using 'class' or 'struct' parameters with variadic Functions
description: This rule searches for C/C++ functions that pass class instances to variadic functions.
output:
Associated to each C/C++ function, method, constructor, and destructor with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in source code:
  - printf() or format() function call
remediation: Review the parameters used to call these functions and try to replace them with native types. One alternative is to use non variadic functions that can allow for more data types.
total: Number of C/C++ functions, constructors, destructors, and methods

qualityStandards.name: Callable and Method Control Element Excessive Number of Parameters
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-parameterization

Consequence
Software that does not cap the number of parameters degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element has a number of parameters in its signature that exceeds a threshold value. Default threshold value for the number of parameters is 7.

qualityStandards.name: Named Callable and Method Control Elements with Variadic Parameter Element
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid using variadic parameter elements

Consequence
Software featuring known weak coding practices results in unexpected and erroneous behaviors

Measure Element
Number of instances where the named callable control element or method control element has a variable number of parameters because of the variadic parameter in its signature

qualityStandards.name: Invokable Control Element with Signature Containing an Excessive Number of Parameters
qualityStandards.description: The software contains a function, subroutine, or method whose signature has an unnecessarily large number of parameters/arguments.
